title: Ruby Basics: Understanding Objects and Methods
content:
Ruby is a dynamic, object-oriented programming language known for its simplicity and elegance. It’s commonly used in web development, especially with the Ruby on Rails framework. Let’s explore the basics of Ruby.

## Variables in Ruby

Variables in Ruby don’t require explicit type declaration. For example:

```ruby
name = 'Alice'  # string
age = 30  # integer
```

## Methods in Ruby

Methods in Ruby are defined using the `def` keyword:

```ruby
def greet(name)
  "Hello, #{name}!"
end

puts greet('John')
```

## Classes and Objects

In Ruby, everything is an object, and classes are used to define the blueprint for objects:

```ruby
class Person
  def initialize(name, age)
    @name = name
    @age = age
  end

  def introduce
    "Hi, I'm #{@name} and I'm #{@age} years old."
  end
end

person = Person.new('Alice', 30)
puts person.introduce
```

### Conclusion

Ruby’s object-oriented nature and easy-to-understand syntax make it a great language for beginners. By mastering methods and classes, you can create powerful programs with minimal code.
author: Jaydip Satani
